metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15964 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in media in Google Chrome prior to85.0.4183.121 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
